abstracts.cdata!:
The project ratings are as follows:
            Project outcome is satisfactory, sustainability is likely,
            institutional development impact is modest, Bank performance
            is satisfactory, and Borrower performance is satisfactory.
            Lessons learned were grouped around the following issues:
            Selection and performance of contractors; redefining
            performance criteria and sub-contracting arrangements;
            building the capacity of the Borrower's staff and
            contractors; reviewing how advances are recovered, the time
            period for claims, local taxation, and other contract
            conditions; capping the road length covered in a single
            contract and using a different standard to set progress
            milestones; making realistic estimates for work completed
            and the resources required; ensuring adequate quality of
            road designs; reducing implementation delays by reviewing
            the current practices of land acquisition, forest
            clearances, and shifting of utilities; and ensuring client
            acceptance of and involvement in the reform agenda.
